children.subject: Don't know about 61c but the professor for 70 is actually AWESOME!

history.content:
I took 61c and 70 together last sem, and took math 54 a sem before that. 61c is not really hard, it just has projects which could take you some time. 54 is conceptually harder, and I would argue it is harder to get a good grade in it.

You wouldn't know what you are getting yourself into if you take 54, since each teacher has a different format. I personally didn't have a very "good" teacher, so my experience was not as smooth as others who took it with other teachers.

But for 61c the format is basically the same every semester; the same lecture slides, same projects, same labs, same exams. I wouldn't worry about the teacher for 61c, because you can view webcasts of other professors teaching literally the same slides from previous semesters.

...so in summary I would go with 61c :)

You wouldn't know what you are getting yourself into if you take 54, since each teacher has a different format. I personally didn't have a very "good" teacher, so my experience was not as smooth as others who took it with other teachers.

But for 61c the format is basically the same every semester; the same teachers, same projects, same labs, same exams. I wouldn't worry about the teacher for 61c, because you can view webcasts of other professors teaching literally the same slides from previous semesters.

Hey guys. 

Right now I'm signed up to take 54 and 70 over fall, but I don't know if I want to do entirely math-related material for the whole semester. How manageable is 61c and 70 together? my grades really matter and I've heard that the profs for 70 and 61c aren't the greatest next semester. I'll also be doing research, which will take up 10 hours a week. Buy not much else. 

What do y'all think?
Many thanks in advance.
history.subject: 70 + 61c vs 54 + 70
